message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.PL, cs.SE. 

The paper introduces an extension of a probabilistic action language that incorporates decision theory and can be defined in terms of Markov Decision Process (MDP). Therefore, it is likely to be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning), which are both related to decision-making and optimization. Additionally, the paper also discusses the design of a system that can find an optimal policy using an MDP solver, which falls under cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems). The paper also proposes a shorthand notation for the decision-theoretic extension of the probabilistic answer set programming language, which is related to cs.PL (Programming Languages). Finally, the paper discusses the benefits of the proposed approach in terms of elaboration tolerance, which is related to cs.SE (Software Engineering).
